snippet: Scientists discovered that every human body has a unique health-promoting team of up to a thousand kinds of microbes.
abstract: Human Microbiome Project publishes the results of its five-year endeavor in journal Nature and three PLoS journals; research finds that human beings contain thousands of diverse bacterial strains that live largely peaceful lives within their hosts; project involved the sequencing of genetic material of bacteria from nearly 250 healthy people.
lead_paragraph: Scientists discovered that every human body has a unique health-promoting team of up to a thousand kinds of microbes.

headline.seo: Human Microbiome Project Explores Our 100 Trillion Good Bacteria
headline.main: In Good Health? Thank Your 100 Trillion Bacteria
headline.print_headline: In Good Health? Thank Your 100 Trillion Bacteria
